  • View page source

Lens Spaces \(L(p,1) = \mathbb{S}^{3}/\mathbb{Z}_{p}\) As Circle Bundles Over \(\mathbb{S}^{2}\)

Given a vector \(v\in \mathbb{S}^{2}\) and an integer \(p\in \mathbb{Z}\), one has a continuous, free right \(\mathbb{S}^{1}\)-action on \(\mathbb{S}^{3}\) defined by \(q\cdot e^{i\theta} = qe^{i\frac{v}{2}}\) (here we are identifying \(\mathbb{S}^{3}\) with the unit quaternions and \(\mathbb{S}^{2}\) with the pure imaginary unit quaternions). The hopf projection map \(\pi:\mathbb{S}^{3}\to \mathbb{S}^{2}\) defined by \(\pi(q) = qvq^{-1}\) is equivariant with respect to this action, so we obtain a new principal \(\mathbb{S}^{1}\)-bundle whose total space is the lens space \(\mathbb{S}^{3}/\mathbb{Z}_{p}\) (and whose projection map is defined by \(\widetilde{\pi}([q]) = [\pi(q)]\)). The Euler number of this bundle is \(\pm p\).

import numpy as np
import circle_bundles as cb

First, generate a sample of the 3-sphere:

n_samples = 5000
s3_data = cb.sample_sphere(n = n_samples, dim = 3)

Compute base projections to \(\mathbb{S}^{2}\) using the Hopf projection map:

base_points = cb.hopf_projection(s3_data)

Construct an open cover of \(\mathbb{S}^{2}\):

n_landmarks = 80
s2_cover = cb.get_s2_fibonacci_cover(base_points, n_vertices = n_landmarks)
bundle = cb.Bundle(X = s3_data, cover = s2_cover, show_summary = True)

Cover And Nerve Summary

  • $n_\text{sets} = 80$, $n_\text{samples} = 5000$

Recorded Simplex Counts:

  • $#(\text{0-simplices}) = 80$

  • $#(\text{1-simplices}) = 234$

  • $#(\text{2-simplices}) = 156$

  • No recorded simplices in dimensions $\ge 3$

Now, choose a value of \(p\) for the quotient metric on \(\mathbb{S}^{3}\). Compute local trivializations and characteristic classes.

p = 4  #CHOOSE: a p-value for the quotient metric

bundle.total_metric = cb.S3QuotientMetric(p=p, antipodal = False)


local_triv_result = bundle.get_local_trivs(show_summary = True)
class_result = bundle.get_classes(show_summary = True)
\[\begin{split}\displaystyle \begin{aligned}\textbf{Local Trivialization Summary} & \\[6pt]\quad \text{Trivialization error} &:\quad \varepsilon_{\text{triv}} := \sup_{(j\,k)\in\mathcal{N}(\mathcal{U})}\sup_{x\in\pi^{-1}(U_j\cap U_k)} d_{\mathbb{C}}(\Omega_{jk}f_k(x),f_j(x)) = 0.297\ \left(\varepsilon_{\text{triv}}^{\text{geo}}=0.095\pi\right)\\[3pt]\quad \text{Mean triv error} &:\quad \bar{\varepsilon}_{\text{triv}} = 0.067\ \left(\bar{\varepsilon}_{\text{triv}}^{\text{geo}}=0.021\pi\right)\\[3pt]\quad \text{Surjectivity defect} &:\quad \delta := \sup_{(i\,j\,k)\in\mathcal{N}(\mathcal{U})}\min_{v\in\{i,j,k\}} d_H\!\left(f_v(\pi^{-1}(U_i\cap U_j\cap U_k)),\mathbb{S}^1\right) = 0.888\\[3pt]\quad \text{Stability ratio} &:\quad \alpha := \varepsilon_{\text{triv}}/(1-\delta) = 2.643\\[3pt]\quad \text{Cocycle error} &:\quad \varepsilon_{\mathrm{coc}} := \sup_{(i\,j\,k)\in\mathcal{N}(\mathcal{U})}\left\|\Omega_{ij}\Omega_{jk}\Omega_{ki}-I\right\|_F = 0.315\end{aligned}\end{split}\]
\[\begin{split}\displaystyle \begin{aligned}\textbf{Characteristic Classes} & \\[6pt]\quad \text{Stiefel--Whitney} &:\quad w_1 = 0\ (\text{orientable})\\[3pt]\quad \text{Euler number} &:\quad \pm 4\ (\text{spin})\\[3pt]\quad \text{Euler rounding dist.} &:\quad d_\infty(\delta\theta, e) = 0.0356\end{aligned}\end{split}\]
\[\displaystyle \textbf{Class Persistence}\]
\[\begin{split}\displaystyle \begin{array}{lrrrrr}\textbf{Stage} & k & r & |W_r^{(1)}| & |W_r^{(2)}| & |W_r^{(3)}| \\ \hline \text{Full nerve} & 0 & \infty & 234 & 156 & 0 \\ \text{w₁ cobirth} & 0 & \infty & 234 & 156 & 0 \\ \text{w₁ codeath} & 0 & \infty & 234 & 156 & 0 \\ \text{Euler cobirth} & 0 & \infty & 234 & 156 & 0 \\ \text{Euler codeath} & 1 & 0.138 & 233 & 154 & 0\end{array}\end{split}\]
